How can I set the border color of particular widgets in my Tkinter application? I am currently trying to modify the background color of my app, however, for some specific widgets, there is a white border around the edges. Here is my current code:

```python
from tkinter import *

COLOR = "black"

root = Tk()
root.config(bg=COLOR)

button = Button(text="button", bg=COLOR)
button.pack(padx=5, pady=5)
entry = Entry(bg=COLOR, fg='white')
entry.pack(padx=5, pady=5)
text = Text(bg=COLOR, fg='white')
text.pack(padx=5, pady=5)

root.mainloop()
```

In Tkinter, some widgets like `Button`, `Entry`, and `Text` can have default border colors that may not change simply by setting the `bg` (background) color. To change the border color, you can use the `highlightbackground`, `highlightcolor`, and `highlightthickness` options to modify the appearance of the widget border. Here's how you can update your code to adjust the border color for these widgets:

```python
from tkinter import *

COLOR = "black"
BORDER_COLOR = "gray"  # Change this to your desired border color

root = Tk()
root.config(bg=COLOR)

button = Button(
    text="button",
    bg=COLOR,
    highlightbackground=BORDER_COLOR,
    highlightcolor=BORDER_COLOR,
    highlightthickness=2  # Thickness of the border
)
button.pack(padx=5, pady=5)

entry = Entry(
    bg=COLOR,
    fg='white',
    highlightbackground=BORDER_COLOR,
    highlightcolor=BORDER_COLOR,
    highlightthickness=2
)
entry.pack(padx=5, pady=5)

text = Text(
    bg=COLOR,
    fg='white',
    highlightbackground=BORDER_COLOR,
    highlightcolor=BORDER_COLOR,
    highlightthickness=2
)
text.pack(padx=5, pady=5)

root.mainloop()
```

In this updated code:
- `highlightbackground` sets the color of the border when the widget is not focused.
- `highlightcolor` sets the color of the border when the widget is focused.
- `highlightthickness` specifies the thickness of the border.

Adjust the `BORDER_COLOR` and `highlightthickness` values as needed to achieve the desired appearance.
